docs.text:
HMAX documentation


Welcome to the HMAX documentation.
docs.title: Home

docs.text:
Installation


HMAX is written in 
Matlab
. Matlab is a proprietary software so you must have a Matlab licence.


Plus, in order to run HMAX, you must have theses Toolboxes:








Requirement










Matlab >2017






Optimization toolbox






Parallel Computing Toolbox (optionnal)






Global Optimization Toolbox (sparse coding only)






Statistics and Machine Learning Toolbox (classification)








Then download the code through git: 


git clone https://github.com/bguyl/HMAX.git




Or download it directly 
here
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: HMAX is written in  Matlab . Matlab is a proprietary software so you must have a Matlab licence.  Plus, in order to run HMAX, you must have theses Toolboxes:     Requirement      Matlab >2017    Optimization toolbox    Parallel Computing Toolbox (optionnal)    Global Optimization Toolbox (sparse coding only)    Statistics and Machine Learning Toolbox (classification)     Then download the code through git:   git clone https://github.com/bguyl/HMAX.git  Or download it directly  here
docs.title: Installation

docs.text:
Get started


Open the project with Matlab.


First, you need to train the model


hmax('../dataset/training/', 'Train', true)




Then run it on your dataset


hmax('../dataset/test/')




This will read recursively the 
../dataset/test/
 folder architecture and create a similar one in the 
./result
 folder.

Each images will give a Matlab binary file containing the HMAX encoding.


If your folders name corresponding to the class name of the images, then you can run the following command:


T = classifier.loadC2s('./results/')




Where 
T
 is a table containing the HMAX encoding with the corresponding encoding.
docs.title: Get started

docs.text:
Open the project with Matlab.  First, you need to train the model  hmax('../dataset/training/', 'Train', true)  Then run it on your dataset  hmax('../dataset/test/')  This will read recursively the  ../dataset/test/  folder architecture and create a similar one in the  ./result  folder. 
Each images will give a Matlab binary file containing the HMAX encoding.  If your folders name corresponding to the class name of the images, then you can run the following command:  T = classifier.loadC2s('./results/')  Where  T  is a table containing the HMAX encoding with the corresponding encoding.
docs.title: Get started
